column1: Text
hi I'm Ellie thanks for coming in today
created to talk to people in space
and please
are you okay with this
yeah
how are you doing today
I'm okay
Burbank California
yeah
the weather of course I think everyone likes the weather
it's not too
City like Chicago or New York it's a big enough we have beaches we're not landlocked
sometimes the smog the traffic the fact that I've just been here like my entire life almost
okay
I'm sure you can tell by my shoes I'm not much of a world Explorer
do you travel a lot
not enough as I'd like to I go to school in Chicago and I've been to New York a couple times San Francisco and I took a road trip across the country that was cool I saw a couple States
what do you enjoy about traveling
see new places
going to Landmark that I've only
read about ER theme pictures of
I traveled from Los Angeles to Chicago taking Route 66 and the best part was seeing the Grand Canyon for the first time it was
the coolest thing I've ever seen probably
happy
and then Happy was as beautiful it was nice
I haven't felt like that in a long time
I'm studying film
it's just

something I've always loved for as long as I could remember and when it came time to start applying to schools I wasn't sure what I wanted to do and I apply to Northwestern as a film student and it just ended up being the right decision
dream job
I love making movies but part of me really loves making people laugh and being in front of the camera so
comedian I'm coming a comedic actor would be totally great but
you consider yourself more shy or
I am super outgoing and I love talking to people a lot I like I like being the center of attention usually
hey
but it's the best I've got
I
I like to watch mindless television like Toddlers & Tiaras and Duck Dynasty just TV programs were really don't have to pay attention at all
okay
how are you at controlling your temper
I'm okay at it I get really emotional really fast but I am usually able to use to keep my anger down and not like lash out at others and stuff for the most part
sometimes I get into like arguments and fights with my friends and people who are important to me really easily
and I hate apologizing to people so besides could last pretty long
my best friend Ryan I think
and it was about
our relationship and just how we kind of messed it up and cross some lines and
where how we were going to go back to the way it was before
how hard is that
really hard it's he's my best friend and I miss him
but we messed up and this is just not the same
it's like not the same friendship
me too
too many
I guess
when I have a boyfriend and he has a girlfriend because not okay I wish I would have just
realize that this was bad and just would have stopped there and not have let it continue 4 weeks which led to my break up and then our friendship being really messed up
I guess not spend as much time with him as I did
be more assertive
I guess
it was
in November
I was very depressed and suicidal
so I told my friend what I was feeling and that she needed to take me to the ER
and from the ER I have the choice to
I don't know I guess go home or get sent to a mental hospital
and even though I felt like I didn't have a choice I knew it was my choice and I decided to go to the mental hospital which is like the worst experience of my life ever
it was awful it was in Chicago and
it was scary and I didn't know anyone and they just like take all your stuff and they put you in some scrubs and they just

start giving you medication and you're basically left to your own devices they were only like three group therapy sessions a day and everyone there was mostly men and they were all really old and it was scary I didn't know anyone everyone most of the people there weren't depressed they were violent so that was pretty scary and I just dumb it was really hard for me

I had been so depressed for like a month I stopped going to my classes and work and I told my teachers lies about being sick and I just kept calling in sick to work I dropped a class and I was failing my classes and not turned in any work and I wasn't talking to any of my friends and I was drinking a lot and passing out and vomiting everywhere and
I was just in a really bad place and when I finally was going to kill myself I realized I needed help
it was

I had severe depression when I was a younger teenager and I tried to kill myself then and I got put in therapy for quite some time so I figured I don't want to go down that bad path again I just want to get better
so I had to do it I had to get help
I do I go once a week
I feel like if you have the right therapist it's really useful
I had one therapist that I really liked and I thought we could have gone really far but sadly she's back in Chicago and I'm in Los Angeles so I have to
have to make do with this new therapist and she's okay
just not we're not that great together but she's who I have right now
better than nothing
not that easy at all
ever since I got out of the hospital and start a night began medication for my depression
just haven't been able to sleep well falling asleep is hard staying asleep is hired have really crazy vivid dreams that wake me up in are disturbing
like what
I guess just
sometimes they reflect things that I'm worried about are happening in my life but they're just

the scary and they seem so real that sometimes I wake up and I have to ask my mom like did we go here to be do this to this really happen and it's usually know you dreamed that sometimes I've gotten so scared I like talk in my sleep and wake myself up
probably like two nights ago
wow
tell me about the last time you felt really happy
that is a
hard question
I think
and November
after I got out of the hospital

I finally had one good day and my friend took me into downtown Chicago and we went to the Sears Tower and got to look over those like big windows that you walk out on and see the city and that was with the cool
how your best friend
probably
super outgoing likes to be the center of attention funny and a little bit crazy
I try not to regret things in my life
I would say that living is worth it and just don't be afraid to ask for help when you need it don't wait until it gets really bad

I guess my ideal weekend would be sleeping in and then catching a movie with my friends may be going home with them and bake some cookies eat all the cookies watch some TV have a sleepover and then like make pancakes in the morning and watch more movies we watch a lot of movies I would like to do my free time
go for a walk I don't know go to the beach
that is a hard question I mean I think I've done a lot of great things in my life
and I have achieved a lot but
I think one of the proudest things badass moments in my life is something really small and insignificant I was doing this exercise boot camp and
the last persons like cross the finish line had to do like

30 pushups and it was some guy I didn't really know him at all and the trainer said does anyone want to help him if he's going to help them you have to do half each and no one wanted to help him and then I just decided to start doing push ups with him and I just
it wasn't cuz I wanted to get creditor because I thought it would make me look good I just did it and no one really knows about that but it's just I feel really good about that
